channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Harvard University on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Approximating mutual information of high-dimensional variables using learned representations
item.description: Latent Mutual Information (LMI) approximation accurately estimates mutual information in high-dimensional data using low-dimensional learned representations, solving a critical problem in various scie…

item.title: Axioms for AI Alignment from Human Feedback
item.description: This paper revolutionizes AI alignment by applying social choice theory axioms to RLHF, exposing flaws in existing methods and proposing novel, axiomatically guaranteed reward learning rules.

item.title: Emergence of Hidden Capabilities: Exploring Learning Dynamics in Concept Space
item.description: Generative models learn hidden capabilities suddenly during training, which can be explained and predicted using a novel ‘concept space’ framework that analyzes learning dynamics and concept signal.

item.title: Evaluating the World Model Implicit in a Generative Model
item.description: New metrics reveal that generative models often possess surprisingly incoherent world models, despite seemingly accurate next-token predictions. This incoherence leads to fragility in solving related …

item.title: Generalized Protein Pocket Generation with Prior-Informed Flow Matching
item.description: PocketFlow: a novel generative model designs high-affinity protein pockets using prior-informed flow matching, outperforming existing methods.

item.title: Hardness of Learning Neural Networks under the Manifold Hypothesis
item.description: Neural network learnability under the manifold hypothesis is hard except for efficiently sampleable manifolds.

item.title: Honor Among Bandits: No-Regret Learning for Online Fair Division
item.description: Online fair division algorithm achieves √ï(T¬≤/¬≥) regret while guaranteeing envy-freeness or proportionality in expectation, a result proven tight.

item.title: Multistable Shape from Shading Emerges from Patch Diffusion
item.description: A novel diffusion model reconstructs multimodal shape distributions from shading, mirroring human multistable perception.

item.title: Optimal ablation for interpretability
item.description: Optimal ablation (OA) improves model interpretability by precisely measuring component importance, outperforming existing methods. OA-based importance shines in circuit discovery, factual recall, and …

item.title: Unitary Convolutions for Learning on Graphs and Groups
item.description: Stable deep learning on graphs achieved using novel unitary group convolutions, preventing over-smoothing and enhancing model robustness.
